etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "person") refers to an individual human being; 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") is often used as a measure word for people. The combination 人口(人口) (rénkǒu) refers to the collective number of persons, thus meaning "population."
etymology.interpretation: 人口(人口) (rénkǒu) literally brings together the characters for "person" and "mouth." Historically, 口(口) (kǒu) has been used as a measure word for people, reflecting counting or resources needed for each person. Thus, the term describes the population as the sum of individuals.

parts.english: mouth; opening; measure word for people

examples.chinese: 中国人口很多(中國人口很多)。
城市人口增长快(城市人口增長快)，农村人口减少(農村人口減少)。
examples.pinyin: Chéngshì rénkǒu zēngzhǎng kuài, nóngcūn rénkǒu jiǎnshǎo.
examples.english: Urban population grows rapidly, while rural population declines.

examples.chinese: 人口老龄化影响社会发展(人口老齡化影響社會發展)。
